meanings.definition: The act of making something more human-like.
meanings.sent1: The humanization of the robot made it seem more like a person.
meanings.sent2: The humanization of the cartoon character gave it emotions and expressions.
meanings.sent3: The humanization of the toy dinosaur made it start talking and walking around.
meanings.sent4: The humanization of the tree in the story made it come alive with feelings and thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The humanization of the alien in the movie made it relatable and understandable to the audience.

meanings.definition: The process of imbuing human qualities or characteristics onto something.
meanings.sent1: The humanization of the robot with emotions made it more relatable to humans.
meanings.sent2: The humanization of the animal character in the book made it act like a person.
meanings.sent3: The humanization of the car in the movie made it start talking and making decisions.
meanings.sent4: The humanization of the computer program gave it a sense of humor and empathy.
meanings.sent5: The humanization of the robot with feelings and thoughts made it seem almost alive.

meanings.definition: The act of treating someone or something with kindness and compassion.
meanings.sent1: The humanization of the stray dog involved giving it food and shelter.
meanings.sent2: The humanization of the patient included listening to their concerns and providing comfort.
meanings.sent3: The humanization of the old teddy bear involved sewing up its torn seams and cleaning it gently.
meanings.sent4: The humanization of the neglected garden involved watering the plants and removing the weeds with care.
meanings.sent5: The humanization of the lonely child involved spending time with them and showing them love and care.
